trans-unit.source: Identifies the start or end of story composed of one or more <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment"></xref> elements.
trans-unit.target: Identifica o início ou término de texto composto de um ou mais <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment"> </xref> elementos.

trans-unit.source: A StoryBreak can only be a child element of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.
trans-unit.target: Um StoryBreak só pode ser um elemento filho de <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Additionally, a StoryBreak can only be the first child, last child, or both the first and last child elements in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.
trans-unit.target: Além disso, um StoryBreak só pode ser o primeiro filho, o último filho ou os dois elementos filho e o sobrenome em <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The location of the StoryBreak element in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> indicates if the story is contained in additional fragments, and if the additional fragments either precede or follow the current fragment.
trans-unit.target: O local do elemento StoryBreak em um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>indica se o texto estiver contido em fragmentos adicionais e se os fragmentos adicionais precedem ou execute o fragmento atual.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: A StoryBreak as the first element in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> indicates the start of a story.
trans-unit.target: Um StoryBreak como o primeiro elemento em um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>indica o início de uma história.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: ``` <!-- Fragment 1 --> <StoryFragment> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the start of a story when --> <!-- immediately after an opening <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> </ParagraphStructure> </StoryFragment> <!-- Story continues in the next <StoryFragment>. --> ``` A StoryBreak as the last element in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> indicates the end of a story.
trans-unit.target: ``` <!-- Fragment 1 --> <StoryFragment> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the start of a story when --> <!-- immediately after an opening <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> </ParagraphStructure> </StoryFragment> <!-- Story continues in the next <StoryFragment>. --> ```Um StoryBreak como o último elemento em um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>indica o final de um texto.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: ``` <!-- Fragment 2 --> <StoryFragment> <!-- Story continued from prior <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the end of a story when --> <!-- immediately before a closing </StoryFragment>. --> </StoryFragment> ``` A story that is contained in a single <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> will have two StoryBreak elements as the first and last child elements of the fragment.
trans-unit.target: ``` <!-- Fragment 2 --> <StoryFragment> <!-- Story continued from prior <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the end of a story when --> <!-- immediately before a closing </StoryFragment>. --> </StoryFragment> ```Um texto que está contido em uma única <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>terá dois elementos StoryBreak como os elementos filho e o sobrenome do fragmento.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: ``` <!-- Fragments 1 and 2 Merged --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> ``` <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> elements that are entirely contained on one page will start and end with StoryBreak elements since the content is completely contained in a single fragment.
trans-unit.target: ``` <!-- Fragments 1 and 2 Merged --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> ``` <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>elementos que são totalmente contidos em uma única página serão começar e terminar com elementos StoryBreak desde que o conteúdo é totalmente contido em um único fragmento.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The position of StoryBreak elements in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> is useful when you want to access content in either forward or reverse direction in the document.
trans-unit.target: A posição dos elementos StoryBreak em um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>é útil quando você deseja acessar o conteúdo na direção direta ou inversa no documento.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: For example when merging fragments in forward order, a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that ends with a StoryBreak indicates the end of the story and that there are no more fragments to merge.
trans-unit.target: Por exemplo quando a mesclagem de fragmentos em ordem subsequente, um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que termina com um StoryBreak indica o final do texto e que não há nenhuma mais fragmentos para mesclar.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Similarly when merging story fragments in reverse order, a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that starts with a StoryBreak indicates the start of the story and that there are no prior fragments to merge.
trans-unit.target: Da mesma forma quando história mesclar fragmentos na ordem inversa, um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que começa com um StoryBreak indica o início do texto e que não há nenhum fragmentos anteriores a serem mesclados.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The ability to process story fragments in either forward or reverse directions is important for many application uses.
trans-unit.target: A capacidade de processar os fragmentos de texto em direções direta ou inversa é importante para muitos usos de aplicativo.

trans-unit.source: For example, a paragraph that spans page breaks is divided into multiple story fragments, one fragment for each page.
trans-unit.target: Por exemplo, um parágrafo que abrange as quebras de página é dividido em vários fragmentos de texto, um fragmento de cada página.

trans-unit.source: A user interface that provides a triple-click feature to select and copy a whole paragraph to the clipboard must be able to merge multiple story fragments when a paragraph spans multiple pages.
trans-unit.target: Uma interface de usuário que fornece um recurso de clique três vezes para selecionar e copiar um parágrafo inteiro para a área de transferência deve ser capaz de mesclar vários fragmentos de texto quando um parágrafo abrange várias páginas.

trans-unit.source: Additionally if the user triple-clicks on part of a paragraph that starts on the first page, the application must identify that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> starts with a StoryBreak but does not end with a StoryBreak.
trans-unit.target: Além disso se o usuário clica três vezes em parte de um parágrafo que inicia na primeira página, o aplicativo deve identificar que a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>começa com um StoryBreak, mas não termina com um StoryBreak.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: This would indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that is contained on the next page must be loaded and added to the end of the current fragment.
trans-unit.target: Isso indica que o <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que está contida na próxima página deve ser carregada e adicionada ao final do fragmento atual.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Similarly if the user triple-clicks on part of the paragraph located on the last page, the application must identify that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> ends with a StoryBreak but does not begin with a StoryBreak.
trans-unit.target: Da mesma forma se o usuário clica três vezes na parte do parágrafo localizado na última página, o aplicativo deve identificar que a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>termina com um StoryBreak, mas não começa com um StoryBreak.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: This would indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that is contained on previous page must be loaded and added to the start of the current fragment.
trans-unit.target: Isso indica que o <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que é independente na página anterior deve ser carregado e adicionado ao início do fragmento atual.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The application should also be able to process both forward and reverse directions for the case of large paragraphs that span three or more pages and where the user's selection point is on an inner page.
trans-unit.target: O aplicativo também deve ser capaz de processar instruções diretas e inversas para o caso de grandes parágrafos que abrangem três ou mais páginas e em que ponto a seleção do usuário está em uma página interna.

trans-unit.source: Since a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> is limited to a single page, the use of StoryBreak elements allow each <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> to contain well-formed XML but still have a hierarchical structure across an entire document.
trans-unit.target: Como um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>é limitado a uma única página, o uso de StoryBreak elementos permitem que cada <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>conter XML bem formado, mas ainda tem uma estrutura hierárquica de um documento inteiro.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> </xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryBreak"></xref> class.
trans-unit.target: Inicializa uma nova instância do <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryBreak"> </xref> classe.
